## How to add a series of assessment meetings as learning objects?

John would like to have a series of assessment meetings for the oral
questioning. Learners can select their desired meeting slots and attend the
exam separately. Now let’s see how John will add the assessment meeting in
Curricula.

1\. In Curricula, John clicks **Course** on the left navigation pane, and
finds his course.

2\. John clicks **Configure** and he can see the learning paths that he
configured.

3\. He locates an existing content group or create a new one, and then clicks
the learning object type **Assessment meeting**.

4\. John fills in the learning object information and clicks **Save and
publish**.

5\. In the **Publish learning object** panel, he configures the following
settings for each class:

• **Enable learner booking**

John needs to choose whether to allow learners to book meeting a slot for
themselves. If learner booking is disabled, after publishing the assessment
meeting, staff can find the **Booking list** button on the **Publish learning
object** panel. When the booking open time arrives, staff can book meeting
slots for learners by clicking the **Booking list** button or they can find
the assessment meeting on the **Result** > **Tasks** page to manage booking.

• **Meeting slot settings**

After configuring meeting slot settings, Alex clicks **Preview** to check the
meeting slots.

• **Meeting settings**

The supported meeting apps are Microsoft Teams and Zoom. For Zoom, the meeting
host is the user who can start the meeting in Zoom and cannot be assigned to
multiple meetings at the same time.

• **Open time and close time for booking**

Learners can book meeting slots for their assessments during the booking time.
Once the close time arrives, they cannot book any assessment meeting.

6\. When John finishes the configurations for a class, he clicks **Publish**.
The assessment meeting will be published to learners.
